.. _`bio/vg/sim`:

VG SIM
======

Samples sequences from the xg-indexed graph.

**URL**: 

Example
-------

This wrapper can be used in the following way:

.. code-block:: python

    rule sim:
        input:
            xg="x.xg"
        output:
            reads="reads/x.seq"
        params:
            "--read-length 100 --num-reads 100 -f"
        log:
            "logs/vg/sim/x.log"
        threads:
            4
        wrapper:
            "0.50.4-2418-g8fefa1e53/bio/vg/sim"

Note that input, output and log file paths can be chosen freely.

When running with

.. code-block:: bash

    snakemake --use-conda

the software dependencies will be automatically deployed into an isolated environment before execution.

Software dependencies
---------------------

* ``vg==1.27.0``

.. code-block:: python

    __author__ = "Ali Ghaffaari"

    from snakemake.shell import shell

    log = snakemake.log_fmt_shell(stdout=False)

    shell(
        "(vg sim {snakemake.params} --xg-name {snakemake.input.xg}"
        " --threads {snakemake.threads} > {snakemake.output.reads}) {log}"
    )
